comment: In endgames, the general rule of thumb is: keep your pawns on opposite colors of your bishop, and the same color as your opponent's (to limit scope of the enemy bishop). ...Kf7 would be a nice way to limit white's activity, while getting black's king active to help the black pawn mass to advance.
reasoning: The comment accurately explains the mistake as it suggests a better move (Kf7) to limit white's activity and get the black king active, aligning with general endgame strategies.

comment: A narrow escape by white. Be careful when an enemy bishop or rook is on the same line as your queen or king. There may some nasty discoveries, as there was this game. Also, try not to allow your opponent a massive pawn center. Passed pawns (pawns unopposed by enemy pawns) are very dangerous. Keep a close eye on your opponent's passed pawns, and support your own the best you can.
reasoning: The comment correctly explains the mistake made by the player, providing advice on avoiding similar issues in the future.
